name: Insurer
label: insurer
definition: financial service provider that issues an insurance policy

name: CollateralizedGuaranty
label: collateralized guaranty
definition: guaranty that takes the form of some asset that is pledged by a borrower to a lender (usually in return for a loan)
explanatoryNote: In some cases, the lender may require the borrower to place pledged assets such as cash or securities in a separate account that the lender controls.

name: Guaranty
definition: commitment whereby something is formally assured if a party with primary liability fails to perform
explanatoryNote: The commitment may cover a debt, cash flows on a debt instrument (such as interest payments), or performance of some obligation.
label: guaranty

name: LetterOfCredit
definition: letter from a bank or other creditworthy institution guaranteeing that a buyer's payment to a seller will be received on time and for the correct amount
explanatoryNote: In some states in the U.S., the issuer is not limited to financial institutions -- it is simply a written instrument, addressed by one person to another, requesting the latter to give credit to the person in whose favor it is drawn.
label: letter of credit

name: LetterOfCreditGuaranty
definition: guaranty that takes the form of a letter of credit, i.e., a document issued by a bank guaranteeing the payment up to a stated amount for a specified period
label: letter of credit guaranty

name: InsurancePolicy
label: insurance policy
definition: contract document that (1) puts an indemnity cover into effect, (2) serves as a legal evidence of the insurance agreement, (3) sets out the exact terms on which the indemnity cover has been provided, and (4) states associated information such as the (a) specific risks and perils covered, (b) duration of coverage, (c) amount of premium, (d) mode of premium payment, and (e) deductibles, if any

name: Guarantor
explanatoryNote: In some cases, the party acting as guarantor may also be a party to the contract, such as in the case of Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac. In such cases, the same individual would be modeled as having both roles.
definition: party that guarantees, endorses, or provides indemnity for some obligation on behalf of some other party
label: guarantor

name: GovernmentGuaranty
label: government guaranty
definition: guaranty provided by a government entity, such as for a government-backed security

name: JointGuaranty
definition: guaranty provided by at least two parties, jointly and severally
label: joint guaranty

name: NegativePledge
definition: guaranty whereby the issuer will not pledge any assets if doing so would result in less security for lender(s) or investor(s)
label: negative pledge

name: InsuranceBackedGuaranty
definition: guaranty that is realized as an insurance policy
label: insurance-backed guaranty

name: PriorityLevel
label: priority level
definition: relative ranking that a guaranty has in the context of a contract, for example for a credit enhancement priority

name: Policyholder
label: policyholder
definition: counterparty to and typically owner of an insurance policy

name: hasGuarantorParty
definition: indicates a party that guarantees, endorses, or provides indemnity for some obligation on its behalf
label: has guarantor party

name: hasPriorityLevel
label: has priority level
definition: relates a guaranty to some relative ranking that the guaranty has in the context of the contract, for example for a credit enhancement priority

name: hasGuaranteedAmount
label: has guaranteed amount
definition: relates the guaranty to the monetary amount guaranteed

name: hasGuarantor
label: has guarantor
definition: relates the guarantor to the contract for which they are providing a guaranty

name: isGuarantorOf
label: is guarantor of
definition: identifies a party over which a guarantor has some measure of control by virtue of the guarantee

name: isGuaranteedBy
label: is guaranteed by
definition: relates guaranty to the contract guarantor, i.e., to the legal person providing the guaranty
